svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2020-03-19T21:51:59.217Z" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:74.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/74.0" etag="30_ac2QADdXJjK6DWLje" version="12.8.8" type="device"><diagram id="tekZV9wYY8VMOtJ2AgmX" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 546px; height: 1px; padding-top: 477px; margin-left: 1459px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

li.font: There will be a total of 7 group tables
Each row of a table will be represent an individual user's responses
All of the columns in the categorical section will simply be added up and displayed as a pie chart, one for likes and dislikes
Each row will have one like and one dislike selected, this will tell PHP which ordinal/Likert questions to present to the user
The ordinal fields can not be averaged, but they can be displayed as frequency tables
Although it was not in the original plans, I would like to add 1 ratio question in the form of rate the project from 1 - 10. This can be averaged to give the groups an overall grade from the class
The answers to the free form questions will simply be echoed onto the group's PDF file

switch.text: There will be a total of 7 group tables...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 328px; height: 1px; padding-top: 477px; margin-left: 1081px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 328px; height: 1px; padding-top: 477px; margin-left: 671px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 546px; height: 1px; padding-top: 477px; margin-left: 60px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 18px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

span.font: There will be 1 user table to keep track of all the users
The email and passwords fields will be hashed in order to ensure anonymity for each user, this will produce better data, since the users will not be afraid to speak their minds

ul.li: The direction is simply a switch that will change the direction of the survey questions responses. In other words, will the scale go from 1-10 or 10-1? Research has shown this gets better data, but should be kept consistent for each user (Ordinal/Likert questions, not ratio)

span.font: The active index simply keeps track of whether or not a user is logged in, in order to avoid logging in from two different machines (server load consideration)
The group number field will ensure the correct pdf is delivered, as well as ensuring that an individual group can not give input on their own project and skew results
The survey fields simply keep track of whether or not a user has commented on a survey already, avoiding double entries by users
The theme field will simplyÂ keep track of which theme each user likes. We can use this information to pick which theme we want for our presentation based on the class's interests

switch.text: There will be 1 user table to keep track of all the users...

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
